subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 1040
msgSnippet: ... Really? I thought AOP is best for weaving the same code into multiple locations without duplicating it. Extending the TestRunner looks to be much simpler,
messageBody:
Chad Woolley wrote:

> Nathan Coast wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > Is anyone doing performance testing with junit or a junit extension?
> I've
> > looked at JUnitPerf and I don't think it has the functionality I
> need. I'd like
> > to record the time taken to execute individual junit tests. The idea
> is that it
> > should then be possible identify when code changes occurred that
> caused a
> > significant drop in performance.
> >
> > thanks
> > Nathan
>
> You could probably do this if you wrote a custom TestRunner.
>
> If you know Aspect-Oriented Programming, this also seems like a good use
> for it.

Really? I thought AOP is best for weaving the same code into multiple
locations without duplicating it. Extending the TestRunner looks to be
much simpler, since one only needs to decorate the TestListener to log
the start and end times.

I do think it's very neat, though, to log all that stuff transparently
and review it over time.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
